com.epoch.courseware

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.courseware.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AppConstants, UserConstants

    public class User
extends Object
implements UserConstants
    A single ACE user.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private String contactAddress
      User's physical address.
      private String email
      User's email address.
      private int flags
      Flags setting permissions for this user.
      private Institution institution
      User's institution (school).
      private Date lastLoginDate
      User's last login date.
      private String[] myLanguages
      Non-English languages of this user in order of preference.
      private Map<String,String> myTranslations
      Phrases encountered by this user that have been translated.

      Name of this user.

      Hashed password of this user.

      User's payment transaction number.
      private String phone
      User's phone number.
      private Date registrationDate
      User's registration date.
      private char role
      Role of user: student, instructor, administrator.
      private boolean savePassword
      A flag to say that DB layer must not overwrite the current password with the value in this object; instead leave it as it is.
      private static String STARS
      Delimiter for variable phrases (to be substituted with other phrases) inside of translations.
      private String studentNum
      User's ID number at his or her institution.
      private String textMessageEmail
      User's email address for receiving text messages by phone.
      private String userId
      User's login ID.

      Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

      Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the given number into the phrase.
      String translate(String phrase, int num)
      Gets translation of selected phrase, or returns the original (and stores it in the database) if the translation is not found, and substitutes the given number into the phrase.
      String translate(String phrase, int[] nums)
      Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the given numbers into the phrase.
      String translate(String phrase, String substn)
      Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the second string into the phrase.
      String translate(String phrase, String[] substns)
      Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the given Strings into the phrase.
      String translateJS(String phrase)
      Gets Javascript-compatible translation of a phrase, or returns the original in Javascript-compatible form if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.
      void translateJS(String[] phrases)
      Gets Javascript-compatible translations of phrases, or leaves them unmodified if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

      Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original.

      Translates an array of phrases, and returns a map with each original phrase mapped to its translation.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
                throws DBException
        Sets whether this user is enabled. Called by profile/saveProfile.jsp and nosession/saveNewUser.jsp. No need to save here, because all this user's data will be saved momentarily.
        Parameters:
        enabled - whether this user should be enabled
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

        Returns:
        true if this user is a temporary exam-student

      • isExamStudent

        public static boolean isExamStudent(String userId)
        Determines whether a user is a temporary exam-student.
        Parameters:
        userId - a user's login ID
        Returns:
        true if a user is a temporary exam-student

      • isExpiredExamStudent

        public boolean isExpiredExamStudent()
        Determines whether a login belongs to an exam-student and has expired.
        Returns:
        true if the login belongs to an exam-student and it has expired

      • hasChangedProfile

        public boolean hasChangedProfile()
        Determines whether the profile of an exam-student has been changed from the default value.
        Returns:
        true if the profile has been changed from the default value

      • setLoginDateToNow

        public void setLoginDateToNow()
        Sets this user's last login date to now.

        Gets this user's security questions and answers.

        question numbers (in format m:n) and answers

      • getSecurityAnswers

        public String[] getSecurityAnswers(boolean byUserId)
        Gets this user's security questions and answers.
        Parameters:
        byUserId - if true, get the security answers by userId; otherwise, by institution and student number
        Returns:
        question numbers (in format m:n) and answers

      • matchSecurityAnswers

        public boolean matchSecurityAnswers(String[] secResponses)
        Determines whether the user's responses to the security questions match the stored answers.
        Parameters:
        secResponses - array of user's two responses to the security questions
        Returns:
        true if the current answers to the security questions match the stored answers

      • matchSecurityAnswers

                                    boolean byUserId)
        Determines whether the user's responses to the security questions match the stored answers.
        Parameters:
        secResponses - array of user's two responses to the security questions
        byUserId - if true, get the security answers by userId; otherwise, by institution and student number
        Returns:
        true if the current answers to the security questions match the stored answers

      • fixNonAsciiUserId

        public boolean fixNonAsciiUserId(String unicodeUserId)
                          throws DBException
        If a userId contains non-ASCII characters, saves the userId with CERs instead.
        Parameters:
        unicodeUserId - replaces the current userId after conversion to CERs
        Returns:
        true if a new username was stored
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • refreshLanguages

        public final void refreshLanguages()
        Gets from the database the non-English languages selected by this user in the preference order set by the user. Called here and from saveLanguages.jsp.

      • setLanguage

        public void setLanguage(String language)
        Sets a temporary non-English language for this user without saving it to the database. Called by nologin/entries.jsp.
        Parameters:
        language - non-English language

      • addLanguage

        public void addLanguage(String language)
                 throws DBException
        Adds a non-English language for this user.
        Parameters:
        language - non-English language
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • setLanguageOrder

        public void setLanguageOrder(int[] newOrder)
                      throws DBException
        Sets the order in which this user's chosen languages should be used.
        Parameters:
        newOrder - new position of each language in current order of languages
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • removeLanguage

        public void removeLanguage(int removePosn)
                    throws DBException
        Removes one of this user's languages.
        Parameters:
        removePosn - 1-based position of the language to be removed, in the current order of the languages
        Throws:
        DBException - if there's a problem writing to the database

      • translateJS

        public String translateJS(String phrase)
        Gets Javascript-compatible translation of a phrase, or returns the original in Javascript-compatible form if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

        This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        Returns:
        Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

      • translate

        public String translate(String phrase)
        Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

        The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        Returns:
        translated phrase or the original

      • translate

        public String translate(String phrase,
                        boolean addNewPhraseToDB)
        Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found.

        The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        addNewPhraseToDB - whether to add a new English phrase to the database
        Returns:
        translated phrase or the original

      • translateJS

        public void translateJS(String[] phrases)
        Gets Javascript-compatible translations of phrases, or leaves them unmodified if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found. Modifies the original array!

        This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

        Parameters:
        phrases - phrases to translate

      • translate

        public void translate(String[] phrases)
        Translates phrases, or leaves unmodified if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found. Modifies the original array!

        Each translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found for a phrase, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

        Parameters:
        phrases - phrases to translate

      • translateToMap

        public Map<String,String> translateToMap(String[] phrasesOrig)
        Translates an array of phrases, and returns a map with each original phrase mapped to its translation.

        Each translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found for a phrase, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

        Parameters:
        phrasesOrig - phrases to translate
        Returns:
        a map of each original phrase keyed to itself

      • translate

        public String translate(String phrase,
                        int num)
        Gets translation of selected phrase, or returns the original (and stores it in the database) if the translation is not found, and substitutes the given number into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".
        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        num - a number to substitute into the phrase
        Returns:
        translated phrase or the original

      • translateJS

        public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          int num)
        Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

        This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        num - a number to substitute into the phrase
        Returns:
        Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

      • translateJS

        public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          String substn)
        Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

        This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        substn - a word or two to substitute into the translated phrase
        Returns:
        Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

      • translate

        public String translate(String phrase,
                        String substn)
        Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the second string into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word*** blah".

        The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        substn - a word or two to substitute into the translated phrase
        Returns:
        translated phrase or the original

      • translateJS

        public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          int[] nums)
        Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word1*** blah blah ***word2*** blah". The order of ***word1*** and ***word2*** may be different in the translation.

        This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        nums - numbers to substitute into the phrase
        Returns:
        Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

      • translate

        public String translate(String phrase,
                        int[] nums)
        Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the given numbers into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word1*** blah blah ***word2*** blah". The order of ***word1*** and ***word2*** may be different in the translation.

        The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        nums - numbers to substitute into the phrase
        Returns:
        translated phrase or the original

      • translateJS

        public String translateJS(String phrase,
                          String[] substns)
        Gets Javascript-compatible translation of selected phrase or the original. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word1*** blah blah ***word2*** blah". The order of ***word1*** and ***word2*** may be different in the translation.

        This method also converts Unicode to character entity references.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        substns - strings to substitute into the phrase
        Returns:
        Javascript-compatible translated phrase or the original

      • translate

        public String translate(String phrase,
                        String[] substns)
        Gets translation of a phrase, or returns the original if a translation in one of the user's selected languages is not found, and substitutes the given Strings into the phrase. Both English and translation will have the form, "blah blah blah ***word1*** blah blah ***word2*** blah". The order of ***word1*** and ***word2*** may be different in the translation.

        The translation (or original phrase) is stored in a Map for lookup later. If no translations at all are found, ACE stores the phrase in the database.

        Parameters:
        phrase - a phrase to translate
        substns - strings to substitute into the phrase
        Returns:
        translated phrase or the original

        Pads a string with one space at beginning and end.
        Parameters:
        str - the string
        Returns:
        the padded string
